text: today's recipe is a really sweet take on
a coconut macaroon it's a tiny little
sandwich cookie instead of your normal
larger mountains of macaron that you
often see start off by whisking two egg
whites in a bowl to that add three
tablespoons of granulated sugar I like
to give that a little bit of a whisk
pinch of salt
then just stir in 8 ounces of sweetened
shredded coconut so far it's a pretty
straight up classic recipe right you
could form these into little mounds or
little mini cups that we filled with
chocolate Easter eggs but today I am
going to make them tiny and sandwich
cookies so I use just so they're
relatively about the same size a
teaspoon measure onto your baking sheet
and then just flatten them out a little
bit into rounds about a heaping teaspoon
if you have a very tiny ice cream scoop
but you could use that you do want them
to be relatively the same size because
you're making them into sandwich cookies
so you don't want them all wonky and
different sizes you don't spread very
much so you can fit plenty onto a baking
sheet as well
you're gonna want to flatten these out
with a fork I mean you can really use
the back of your spoon if you want to
and then you can also use that
opportunity to shape them into neater
arounds have your oven preheating to 350
degrees for these guys that's it for the
cookie portion of this recipe just get
them into the oven and bake them until
you're just golden around the edges that
will take about 13 to 15 minutes
these little guys are golden around the
edges and they're just a little bit
chewy in the center which is exactly
what you're looking for in a macaroon
and you can sandwich them with whatever
kind of jam you like today I have
apricot and raspberry so maybe I'll do a
couple of each you really only need
about a half a teaspoon of jam cuz
they're so tiny place it just in the
center give it a little spread and then
top with a second cookie that's adorable
I love them they're so cute you know I'm
a huge fan of macarons but they can be
you know a lot to eat a whole one I
think but these are the perfect amount
they're just a couple of bites they're
elegant and the sweetness of them is
offset by the Tang that's in the jam so
I think it's all around a great idea and
if you wanted to you could also put
chocolate in here if you're a chocolate
fan and chocolate macaroons are a
holiday favorite
isn't that simple and so adorable I love
these little tiny macaroon sandwiches
and I think you will too give them a try
[Music]
if you like recipes like this and you
want more make sure to click like and
subscribe because we have plenty more
where this came from
you
